cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles SSW of Great Exuma Island
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the Florida Keys, then up the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle and inland across the Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle/Big Bend coast near Apalachee Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch: southwest coast of Florida from Englewood south and east to Ocean Reef; portions of central Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to the Dry Tortugas, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, Bahamas, Florida Keys, west coast of Florida, and the northern Gulf Coast from the Big Bend westward to Alabama
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes, localized totals could approach 4 inches Monday–Tuesday
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤8%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusty squalls possible late Monday–Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of Georgia
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Monday–Tuesday with 2–4 inches common and isolated higher amounts, producing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief marine squalls and reduced visibility could affect pilotage and cargo handling
